info.author: Zulko
info.description:
Zips'n'folders
==============

Zips'n'folders is a Python library to write files to either folders or zip archives.

When a Python program generates multi-file reports, you may want to (1)
write all the files into a well-organized folder, or (2) archive
the files into a zip, or (3) generate the Zip archive in memory to send directly
to some distant client, without writing anything to the hard drive.
Zipsnfolders provides a single function for these three scenarios.

Installation
-------------

Zipsnfolders should work on Windows/Mac/Linux with Python 2 and Python 3.

It can be installed by unzipping the source code in one directory and using this command: ::

    sudo python setup.py install

You can also install it directly from the Python Package Index with this command: ::

    sudo pip zipsnfolders install

Contribute
-----------

Zipsnfolders is an open source software originally written by Zulko_ and
released on Github_ under the MIT licence (¢ Edinburgh Genome Foundry), everyone is welcome to contribute !


Example
--------

Basic usage
~~~~~~~~~~~~~

The simplest way to use Zipsnfolders is with ``write_files``. First make a list of
elements of the form `(file_path, file_content_string)`, for instance:

.. code:: python

    files_contents = [
        ("Readme.txt", "I am the content"),
        ("OtherFile.txt", "Another content"),
        (("texts", "Example.txt"), "Content of a file in the 'texts' folder"),
    ]

Then call ``write_files`` with a target:

.. code:: python

    from zipsnfolders import write_files

    # Let's write in a folder
    write_files(files_contents, target="some_folder")

    # Let's write in a Zip archive
    write_files(files_contents, target="some_archive.zip")

    # Let's generate a Zip archive in memory to send to the client !
    zip_archive_as_string = write_files(files_contents, target="@memory")

Local files, distant files, and files generators
~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~

In the previous example the content of a file was represented as a string.
It is also possible to provide the path to a local file or an url instead:

.. code:: python

    from zipsnfolders import write_files, Url, File
    files = [
        ("python.png", Url("https://www.python.org/static/img/python-logo.png")),
        ("flask.pdf", Url("http://flask.pocoo.org/docs/0.10/.latex/Flask.pdf")),
        ("examples.py", File("basic_examples.py"))
    ]
    write_files(files, "archive.zip")

It is also possible to provide a function ``fun(file_handle)`` which writes
content into a file handle. This allows to write files generated by libraries
such as Matplotlib, Pandas, Weasyprint, etc. It will look as follows:

.. code:: python

    files_contents = [
        ("plot.png", lambda fhandle: figure.savefig(fhandle, format="png")),
        ("report.pdf", some_weasyprint_writer.write_pdf)
    ]


Advanced usage
~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~

If you ever need to control the writing of each file separately: to write to folders
use the ``FolderWriter`` class

.. code:: python

    from zipsnfolders import FolderWriter
    folder_writer = FolderWriter("folder_example", destroy_existing=True)
    folder_writer.write("Readme.txt", "I am the content")
    folder_writer.write(["texts", "example.txt"], "I am another content")

To write to a Zip use the ZipWriter class

.. code:: python

    from zipsnfolders import ZipWriter
    zip_writer = ZipWriter("zip_example.zip", destroy_existing=True)
    zip_writer.write("Readme.txt", "I am the content")
    zip_writer.write(["texts", "example.txt"], "I am another content")
    zip_writer.close()

Same as above, using the `with` statement:

.. code:: python

    with ZipWriter("zip_example2.zip", destroy_existing=True) as zip_writer2:
        zip_writer2.write("Readme.txt", "I am the content")
        zip_writer2.write(["texts", "example.txt"], "I am another content")

To write in memory, use:

.. code:: python

    memory_zip_writer = ZipWriter()
    memory_zip_writer.write("Readme.txt", "I am the content")
    memory_zip_writer.write(["texts", "example.txt"], "Another content")
    memory_zip_writer.close()
    memory_zip_as_string = memory_zip_writer.get_value()

    # Now write the content to a file:
    with open("memory_zip_example.zip", "wb") as f:
        f.write(memory_zip_as_string)

.. _Zulko: https://github.com/Zulko/
.. _Github: https://github.com/Edinburgh-Genome-Foundry/zipsnfolders
info.name: zipsnfolders
info.summary: Simple interface to write files to zips or folders
